Pre-Game Insights: The Thunder are 16-5 in conference play.
The Grizzlies are 9-7 in Western Conference play.
The Thunder make 46.4% of their shots from the field this season, which is 2.5 percentage points higher than the Grizzlies have allowed to their opponents (43.9%).
The Grizzlies average 14.2 made 3-pointers per game this season, 1.6 more made shots on average than the 12.6 per game the Thunder give up.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Oklahoma City ranks seventh in the Western Conference with 33.8 defensive rebounds per game led by Isaiah Hartenstein averaging 9.9.
Memphis ranks sixth in the NBA with 12.7 offensive rebounds per game led by Zach Edey averaging 3.7.
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander is averaging 30.8 points, 5.6 rebounds, 6.1 assists and two steals for the Thunder.
Santi Aldama is averaging 13 points and 7.3 rebounds for the Grizzlies.
Others: The Thunder are 10-0 in their last 10 games, averaging 116.8 points, 46.2 rebounds, 25.6 assists, 12.3 steals and 5.1 blocks per game while shooting 47.5% from the field.
The Grizzlies are 8-2 in their last 10 games, averaging 129.6 points, 50.7 rebounds, 30.9 assists, 10.5 steals and 5.7 blocks per game while shooting 48.6% from the field.
The Thunder's opponents have averaged 101.6 points per game, while the Grizzlies' opponents have averaged 114.7 points.

The Thunder are facing injuries to Cason Wallace, Chet Holmgren, Luguentz Dort, Branden Carlson, and Nikola Topic, while the Grizzlies are facing injuries to Marcus Smart, Brandon Clarke, Santi Aldama, Vince Williams Jr., Ja Morant, and GG Jackson II.
